text: a crowd in the libyan city of Tobruk
celebrated tuesday night as opposition
forces claimed to have seized control of
cities along the northeastern coast
Libya's rebellion is the bloodiest of
the uprisings that have swept across the
Arab world Human Rights Watch confirmed
at least 62 deaths in the capital
Tripoli with more than 200 killed in
clashes elsewhere witnesses describe the
streets of Tripoli as a war zone several
residents believe massacres took place
overnight as forces loyal to Colonel
Qaddafi drove through the streets
opening fire from pickup trucks Colonel
Gaddafi appeared on state television
Tuesday with a defiant message my mother
you Devi ma'am the Muslim had to use a
voice ooh Kidman who giveth I della
Rossa I'm gonna give that face our eyes
okay thora throughout his 42 years in
power Qaddafi has perpetuated some kind
of violence some sort of massacre some
sort of public executions every decade
or so it's kind of a strident warning to
his people don't try and oppose me don't
even think of dissent because I will
kill you and there are heavy
consequences for that but what's
happened in this past couple months is
that there's been a series of uprisings
in the neighborhood specifically next
door in both Tunisia and in Egypt and
Qaddafi went on TV after the Tunisian
rebellion to say it was a foreign plot
but what the people in this region have
sort of suddenly lost their fear of
these repressive regimes and they have
now risen up against Qadhafi and saying
those tactics aren't going to work we
don't believe it's a foreign plot we
were not afraid anymore Qaddafi has
basically hollowed out every institution
in Libya including the army since he
himself was 27 year old major when he
overthrew the king he always feared the
army and so he was always shifting
commanders around and making sure that
they did not get too much power and in
recent years as he's funded more and
more liberation movements or armies or
whatever you want to call them in Africa
when they fail he would bring them back
to the Libya and he would train them as
quote unquote African legions and I
think that's who we see fighting now in
the streets of Tripoli as its mercenary
soldiers who are opening fire on the
people because it would be very hard to
convince the Libyans to fire
their own
